Section.Text: An employee who takes a leave of absence from employment under this Division is entitled, on written request, to be informed in writing of every employment, promotion or training opportunity that arises during the period when the employee is on the leave of absence and for which the employee is qualified, and on receiving the request, every employer of the employee shall inform the employee accordingly.

Section.MarginalNote: Resumption of employment in same position

Subsection.Text: An employee who takes a leave of absence from employment under this Division is entitled to be reinstated in the position that the employee occupied when the leave of absence commenced, and the employer of the employee shall reinstate the employee in that position at the end of the leave.

If for any valid reason an employer cannot reinstate an employee in the position referred to in subsection (1), the employer shall reinstate the employee in a comparable position with the same wages and benefits and in the same location.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Wages and benefits affected by reorganization
Subsection.Text: If an employee takes leave under this Division and, during the period of that leave, the wages and benefits of the group of employees of which that employee is a member are changed as part of a plan to reorganize the industrial establishment in which that group is employed, that employee is entitled, on being reinstated in employment under this section, to receive the wages and benefits in respect of that employment that the employee would have been entitled to receive had they been working when the reorganization took place.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice of changes in wages and benefits
Subsection.Text: The employer of every employee who is on a leave of absence under this Division and whose wages and benefits would be changed as a result of a reorganization referred to in subsection (3) shall notify the employee in writing of that change as soon as possible.
The pension, health and disability benefits and the seniority of any employee who takes a leave of absence from employment under this Division accumulate during the entire period of the leave.

If contributions are required from an employee in order for the employee to be entitled to a benefit referred to in subsection (1), the employee is responsible for and shall, within a reasonable time, pay those contributions for the period of any leave of absence under this Division unless, before or within a reasonable time after taking the leave, the employee notifies the employer of the employee’s intention to discontinue contributions during that period.

An employer who pays contributions in respect of a benefit referred to in subsection (1) shall continue to pay those contributions during an employee’s leave of absence under this Division in at least the same proportion as if the employee were not on leave unless the employee does not pay the employee’s contributions, if any, within a reasonable time.

For the purposes of calculating the pension, health and disability benefits of an employee in respect of whom contributions have not been paid as required under subsections (2) and (3), the benefits do not accumulate during the leave of absence and employment on the employee’s return to work is deemed to be continuous with employment before the employee’s absence.

For the purposes of calculating benefits, other than benefits referred to in subsection (1), of an employee who takes a leave of absence under this Division, employment on the employee’s return to work is deemed to be continuous with employment before the employee’s absence.

Section.Text: Despite the provisions of any income-replacement scheme or any insurance plan in force at the workplace, an employee who takes a leave of absence from employment under this Division is entitled to benefits under the scheme or plan on the same terms as any employee who is absent from work for health-related reasons and is entitled to benefits under the scheme or plan.
No employer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: dismiss, suspend, lay off, demote or discipline an employee because the employee applies for, intends to take or has taken a leave of absence from employment under this Division; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: take into account the fact that an employee applies for, intends to take or has taken a leave of absence from employment under this Division in any decision to promote or train that employee.

Section.Text: The Governor in Council may make regulations

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: defining the expression “immediate family” for the purposes of subsection 210(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of subsection 210(2),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: defining the expressions “regular rate of wages” and “normal hours of work”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: prescribing shorter periods of consecutive months of continuous employment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: specifying what does not constitute a valid reason for not reinstating an employee in the position referred to in subsection 210.2(2);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of this Division, specifying the absences from employment that are deemed not to have interrupted continuity of employment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: specifying the circumstances in which a leave under this Division may be interrupted; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: extending the period within which a leave under this Division may be taken.

Section.Text: Subsection 246.1(1) of the Act is amended by adding the following after paragraph (a):

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: the employer has taken action against the employee in contravention of paragraph 210.5(a) or (b);

Section.Text: Subsection 187.1(2) of the Canada Labour Code is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: If an employee interrupts a vacation to take leave under any of sections 205.1, 206 to 206.1 and 206.3 to 206.9 and resumes the vacation immediately at the end of that leave, section 209.1 applies to them as if they did not resume the vacation before returning to work.

Section.Text: The Act is amended by adding the following after section 206:

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: placement means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the placement of a child into the actual care of an employee for the purposes of adoption under the laws governing adoption in the province in which the employee resides;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the arrival of a new-born child of an employee into the employee’s actual care, in the case where the person who gave birth to the child is not, or is not intended to be, a parent of the child; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other case prescribed by regulation. (placement)

Definition.Text: week means the period between midnight on Saturday and midnight on the immediately following Saturday. (semaine)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (7) and (8), every employee is entitled to and shall be granted a leave of absence from employment of up to 16 weeks for carrying out responsibilities related to a placement.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Period when leave may be taken
Subsection.Text: The leave of absence may only be taken during the period

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: beginning no earlier than six weeks before the week of the estimated date of the placement or, if the actual date of the placement is earlier than the estimated date, no earlier than the week of that actual date; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ending no later than 17 weeks following the week of the actual date of that placement.

Subsection.Text: If the placement is delayed, the period referred to in subsection (3) must not, subject to any extension under subsection (5), end later than 52 weeks following the week of the estimated date referred to in paragraph (3)(a).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Extension of period — child in hospital
Subsection.Text: If, after placement, the child is hospitalized during the period referred to in subsection (3), the period is extended by the number of weeks during which the child is hospitalized.
An extension under subsection (5) must not result in the period referred to in subsection (3) ending later than 52 weeks following the week of the actual date of the placement.
The aggregate amount of leave that may be taken by more than one employee under this section in respect of the same placement must not exceed 16 weeks.

If, during a leave of absence under this section, the employee is informed that the placement will not occur, the leave may continue until the end of the week after the week in which the employee is so informed.

Section.Text: The Act is amended by adding the following after section 206.2:

Section.MarginalNote: Aggregate leave — leave for placement of child and parental leave
Section.Text: The aggregate amount of leave that may be taken by more than one employee under sections 206.01 and 206.1 in respect of the same child shall not exceed 85 weeks, but the aggregate amount of leave that may be taken by one employee under those sections in respect of the same child shall not exceed 77 weeks.

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 207(1) of the Act before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:
Every employee who intends to take a leave of absence from employment under any of sections 206 to 206.1 shall
Subsection 207(2) of the English version of the Act is replaced by the following:

Every employee who intends to take or who is on a leave of absence from employment under any of sections 206 to 206.1 shall provide the employer with notice in writing of at least four weeks of any change in the length of leave intended to be taken, unless there is a valid reason why that notice cannot be given, in which case the employee shall provide the employer with notice in writing as soon as possible.

Section.Text: Section 207.01 of the Act is replaced by the following:
Subject to the regulations, a leave of absence under any of sections 206.01 and 206.3 to 206.5 may only be taken in one or more periods of not less than one week’s duration.
Subsection 207.02(1) of the Act is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: An employee may interrupt a leave of absence referred to in any of sections 206.01 and 206.3 to 206.5 in order to be absent due to a reason referred to in subsection 239(1) or 239.1(1).
Subsection 207.2(1) of the Act is replaced by the following:

Section.MarginalNote: Notification to employer — interruption for child’s hospitalization

Subsection.Text: An employee who intends to interrupt their maternity or parental leave or their leave for the placement of a child in order to return to work as a result of the hospitalization of their child shall provide the employer with a notice in writing of the interruption as soon as possible.
Subsection 207.2(3) of the Act is replaced by the following:

If the employer refuses the interruption or does not advise the employee within the week referred to in subsection (2), the leave under any of sections 206 to 206.1 is extended by the number of weeks during which the child is hospitalized. The aggregate amounts of leave referred to in subsections 206.01(7) and 206.1(3) and sections 206.2 and 206.21 are extended by the same number of weeks.
Subsection 207.2(5) of the Act is replaced by the following:
An employee who intends to return to their leave after the interruption shall, as soon as possible, advise the employer in writing of the date on which the leave is to resume.
Paragraph 209.4(a.2) of the Act is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the maximum number of periods of leave of absence that an employee may take under any of sections 206.01 and 206.3 to 206.5;

Subsection.Text: Section 209.4 of the Act is amended by adding the following after paragraph (c):

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing cases for the purposes of paragraph (c) of the definition placement in subsection 206.01(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c.2)
Paragraph.Text: defining, for the purposes of section 206.01, any word or expression that is used but not defined in that section;

Subsection.Text: In this section, Act means the Canada Labour Code.

An employee who, on the day on which section 357 comes into force, is on parental leave under section 206.1 of the Act and is eligible for leave for the placement of a child under section 206.01 of the Act may interrupt their parental leave to take leave for the placement of a child. Their parental leave resumes immediately after the interruption ends.
Section 207.1 of the Act applies, with any necessary modifications, with respect to an interruption under subsection (2).
Words and expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in the Act.

Section.Text: Subsection 136(11) of the Canada Labour Code is amended by striking out “and” at the end of paragraph (b), by adding “and” at the end of paragraph (c) and by adding the following after paragraph (c):

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a time limit for filling a vacant health and safety representative position.

Section.Text: Paragraph 145(1)(a) of the English version of the Act is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: terminate the contravention within the time that the Head may specify; and

Section.Text: Subsection 175(1) of the Act is amended by adding the following after paragraph (b.1):

Paragraph.Label: (b.2)
Paragraph.Text: defining the expressions “shift” and “work period” for the purposes of sections 173.01 and 173.1;

Section.Text: The Act is amended by adding the following after section 177.1:

Subsection.Text: On or before the first anniversary of the day on which an employer becomes subject to this section, the employer must bring into effect a policy that includes the following elements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a general rule respecting work-related communication outside of scheduled hours of work, including the employer’s expectations and any opportunity for employees to disconnect from means of communication;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any exceptions to the rule and their underlying rationale;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the policy; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any other elements that may be prescribed by regulation.

Subsection.Text: The employer may exclude from the application of the policy any employees who are exempted from sections 169, 171 and 174 or who are referred to in subsection 167(2).

If the parties to a collective agreement agree, in writing, that the agreement meets the requirements of subsection (1) with respect to some or all of the employees who are subject to the agreement, this Division does not apply with respect to those employees.

Section.Text: The employer must bring into effect an updated version of the policy on or before the third anniversary of the effective date of its previous version.

Subsection.Text: In the development and updating of its policy, the employer must consult employees and provide them with at least 90 days to provide their comments.
The employer is not required to consult any employees referred to in subsection 177.2(2) that it intends to exclude from the application of the policy.
If an employee to whom this Division applies is represented by a trade union, the employer must conduct the consultation through the trade union.

Section.Text: In accordance with any requirements prescribed by regulation, the employer must keep a record of information related to the consultation of employees and to the development and updating of the policy.

Subsection.Text: On or before the effective date of the policy, the employer must post and keep posted a copy of it in readily accessible places where it is likely to be seen by the employees to whom it applies.
The employer must provide a copy of the policy in paper or electronic form to every employee to whom the policy applies within 30 days after the day on which it starts applying to them.

If an employee is affected by a condition that impairs their ability to receive the policy when it is provided by a method that would otherwise be sufficient under this Division, the employer must provide them with the policy by any method of communication that readily permits them to receive it, including braille, large print, audio recording, sign language and verbal communication.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for an employer or person acting on behalf of an employer to intimidate, dismiss, penalize, discipline or otherwise take reprisals against an employee, or threaten to take any such action against an employee, because the employee

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: asks the employer to comply with the policy;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: makes inquiries about their rights under the policy;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: files a complaint under the policy; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: exercises or attempts to exercise a right under the policy.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, this Act and the regulations prevail over the policy to the extent of any inconsistency between them.

For greater certainty, in the event of any inconsistency between the policy and a provision of a collective agreement that applies to employees to whom this Division applies, the collective agreement prevails to the extent of the inconsistency.

Section.Text: The Governor in Council may make regulations

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the form of the policy for the purposes of subsection 177.2(1) and section 177.3;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing, for the purposes of paragraph 177.2(1)(d), any other elements to be included in the policy, including any elements to be included in respect of one or more employees or classes of employees; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing the manner in which the policy is to be posted for the purposes of subsection 177.6(1).

Section.Text: Subsection 264(1) of the Act is amended by adding the following after paragraph (f):

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: specifying activities that are or are not considered work for the purposes of this Part or any of its Divisions or provisions;

Paragraph.Label: (g.1)
Paragraph.Text: defining expressions such as “disconnect”, “scheduled hours of work” and “work-related communication” for the purposes of this Part or any of its Divisions or provisions;

Section.Text: On the first day on which both section 249 of this Act and section 480 of the Budget Implementation Act, 2018, No. 2 are in force,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 212.1 of the Canada Labour Code is amended by adding the following after subsection (1):

Subsection.Text: The employer’s obligation to give and the employee’s right to receive notice or wages in lieu of notice under subsection (1) apply whether or not the employee has a right to avail themselves of any procedure for redress under this Part, including under subsection 240(1), with respect to the termination of their employment.

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 242(5) of the Canada Labour Code is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, in making an order for compensation under subsection (4) the Board may, among other things, take into account any amount paid by the employer to the employee under subsection 212.1(1), 230(1) or 235(1).
